metadata.title: CVE-2014-1540 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in thensEventListenerManager::CompileEventHandlerInternal function in the EventListener Manager in Mozilla Firefox before 30.0 allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (heap memorycorruption) via crafted web content.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1540` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 30.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
firefox-globalmenu - 30.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
firefox-mozsymbols - 30.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
firefox-testsuite - 30.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '30.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3').
